metadata.title: CVE-2023-6121 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
An out-of-bounds read vulnerability was found in the NVMe-oF/TCP subsystemin the Linux kernel. This issue may allow a remote attacker to send acrafted TCP packet, triggering a heap-based buffer overflow that results inkmalloc data being printed and potentially leaked to the kernel ring buffer(dmesg).

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-6121` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-lowlatency - 4.4.0-2.16
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-143-generic - 4.15.0-223.235~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-143-generic - 4.15.0-223.235~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-143-lowlatency - 4.15.0-223.235~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1094-kvm - 4.4.0-1004.9
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1129-aws - 4.4.0-1001.10
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1099-gcp - 4.15.0-1160.177~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-2.16').
linux-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-223.235~16.04.1').
linux-kvm package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1004.9').
linux-aws package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1001.10').
linux-aws-hwe: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-azure: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-gcp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1160.177~16.04.1').
linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
